Package infodynamics.measures.discrete

Interface ChannelCalculatorDiscrete

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MutualInformationCalculatorDiscrete, TransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete
    public interface ChannelCalculatorDiscrete
extends EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    A basic interface for calculators computing measures on a univariate channel for discrete (ie int[]) data from a source to a destination time-series (ie mutual information and transfer entropy). In the following, we refer to the abstract measure computed by this calculator as the "channel measure".

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Initialise the calculator using initialise() or other initialise methods defined by child classes;
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to the set of addObservations(int[], int[]) methods, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average channel measure: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • the distribution of channel measure values under the null hypothesis of no relationship between source and destination values: EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance(int);
      • or other quantities as defined by child classes.
    5. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise()
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(int[] source,
                     int[] dest)

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with. It is intended to be called multiple times.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Parameters:
        source - series of observations for the source variable.
        destination - series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(int[][] states,
                     int sourceIndex,
                     int destIndex)

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with, from within a multivariate time-series. It is intended to be called multiple times.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Parameters:
        states - 2D multivariate time series (first index is time second indexes the variable)
        sourceIndex - column index for the source variable.
        destIndex - column index for the destination variable.

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Compute the channel measure from the previously-supplied samples.
        Returns:
        the estimate of the channel measure
